program: Combined Major in Statistics and Economics (B.Sc.)
requirements: Either (a) ECON 326 and STAT 301 OR (b) ECON 398 and STAT 306
additional_requirements: Admission is subject to the admission restrictions/application process for the Major in Economics
Additional Communication Requirement (3 credits)
Economics courses numbered 200 or above (3 credits)
Economics courses numbered 300 or above (3 credits)
Economics courses numbered 400 or above (3 credits)
Statistics courses numbered 300 or above (3 credits)
Statistics courses numbered 400 or above (3 credits)
If STAT 200 is chosen (via the ECON 325 or STAT 200 choice), an additional ECON elective numbered 300+ must be taken to ensure at least 30 ECON credits
Electives must also satisfy Faculty of Science degree requirements (foundational/lab breadth/science & arts/upper-level/etc.)

program: Combined Major in Computer Science and Statistics (B.Sc.)
requirements: MATH 100 or 102 or 104 (or 180 or 184 or 120 or 110)
additional_requirements: Additional Communication Requirement (3 credits)
CPSC courses numbered 300 or above (6 credits)
CPSC courses numbered 400 or above (6 credits) — at least 3 credits must be from 400-level CPSC lecture-based courses
STAT courses numbered 300 or above (6 credits)
STAT courses numbered 400 or above (3 credits)
Admission must be approved by both departments
Electives must also satisfy Faculty of Science degree requirements (foundational/lab breadth/science & arts/upper-level/etc.)
Admission/continuation notes (Calendar): departmental approval required; must meet stated minimums; must maintain an overall 68% average each year
Additional Communication Requirement (3 credits)
STAT courses numbered 300 or above (3 credits)
STAT courses numbered 400 or above (6 credits)
Additional CPSC/DSCI/MATH courses numbered 300 or above (6 credits)
In 4th year: 6 credits chosen from MATH 418/419/420/421 and/or additional STAT 400+ (course-choice requirement)
Electives must also satisfy Faculty of Science degree requirements (foundational/lab breadth/science & arts/upper-level/etc.)

program: Combined Honours in Mathematics and Statistics (B.Sc.)

program: Combined Honours in Computer Science and Statistics (B.Sc.)
